title: how to export Thunderbird emails to MBOX
content:
I am currently using Thunderbird 115.3.1 (64-bit). The about info shows that I can update to 115.10.1, however, I believe there are much later versions but I don't know if I can update to the latest. My MacOS is 10.15.7 and that is the latest I can install.

I have a large amount of email stored on my MAC and not in the cloud.

I want to be able to access these emails that are on my hard drive, in addition to Thunderbird, in Apple Mail.

I have researched and it appears that the best way is to export from Thunderbird is into the mbox format. However, there does not seem to be a way to do this in the version of Thunderbird I am using.

How do I move all of my local email in Thunderbird to my Apple Mail?

Thanks for any help, Richard

title: mailadressen bijvoegen in android
content:

Ik kan mails versturen, en ontvangen, maar voor het verzenden ontbreek ik mijn mailadressen. Kan iemand mij a.u.b. uitleg geven , hoe ik dit kan oplossen.

met vriendelijke groet, Walter wcochuyt@skynet.be

Cher , J'utilise Thunderbird depuis des années et je l'ai également installé sur mon appareil Android. J'ai tout transféré de mon PC à mon appareil Android. Je peux envoyer et recevoir des mails, mais pour l'envoi, il me manque mes adresses mail. J'ai maintenant "Adresses collectées.csv" et "Carnet d'adresses personnel" sur mon appareil, mais je ne peux pas les lire, je ne trouve pas non plus le dossier du carnet d'adresses. Quelqu'un peut-il m'expliquer comment résoudre ce problème ?

Je vous prie d'agréer, Madame, Monsieur, l'expression de mes salutations distinguées, Walter wcochuyt@skynet.be vertaald met DeepL

title: čeština/ jiný jazyk než angličtina
content:
Po instalaci Thbirdu jsem stáhl plug in s češtinou a v nastavení zrušil "jazyk" angličtina, od té chvíle mi běží oprava pravopisu v češtině, ale při psaní zprávy je celý český text podtržený - zjevně podle anglického pravopisu a je to otravné. Přípdné chyby se těžko hledají. V nastavení chybí tlačítko, které je v modzille - "Jazyk", které by tak nejak "natvrdo" nastavilo používání češtiny všude. Připadá mi, že v předchozí verzi, kterou jsem používal na předešlém NTB bylo vše bez problému. Na tomto "zánovním" NTB a vyšší verzi mne to nepříjemně překvapuje.

Přesto děkuji za existenci této skupiny a za to, že vytváří a umožňuje používání této skvělé aplikace zdarma.

J

title: [RISOLTO] Problema importazione email backup
content:
Ciao a tutti,

di recente ho migrato il mio sito su un nuovo server e, prima della migrazione, ho eseguito un backup del profilo di Thunderbird (utilizzo 3 account di posta).

Dopo la migrazione ho ricreato le caselle email e riconfigurato Thunderbird aggiornando le porte dei server e le password. Il client si riavvia e scarica regolarmente la posta senza problemi.

Il problema sorge quando provo a importare le email dal backup: viene creata una cartella locale chiamata "Import Thunderbird", ma al suo interno non compare nulla.

Per verificare se il backup fosse corrotto, ho provato a importare l’intero profilo salvato e in questo caso l’operazione riesce. Tuttavia, non posso mantenerlo perché contiene le vecchie configurazioni. Appena aggiorno le impostazioni con quelle nuove, Thunderbird si riavvia e le vecchie email scompaiono.

Ho utilizzato sia l'estensione ImportExportTools NG per il backup dell’intero profilo, sia l’esportazione nativa di Thunderbird, seguendo la procedura indicata qui:

https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/importa-impostazioni-dati-Thunderbird

Qualcuno ha suggerimenti su come recuperare le vecchie email senza perdere le nuove configurazioni?

Grazie in anticipo!


---> non avevo visto questa guida che altri volontari hanno suggerito: https://radiofaro.neocities.org/kb/index/002

ho risolto grazie a questa. Grazi!
creator: rento1

content: Toen ik vanmorgen Thunderbird opende, gebeurde dat op een me niet bekende manier. Ik moest opnieuw aanmelden, gelukkig kende ik mijn wachtwoord nog. Ik kon meteen verder, maar... al de locale mappen die ik had aangemaakt, waren verdwenen. title: Archiving e-mail on NAS
content: Hi, I hope someone can help me. I've been archiving my e-mail on my Synology NAS for a number of years now. However, my W10 desktop computer died last year and I've had to reinstall Thunderbird on a new W11 PC. I want to get access to all the archived e-mails on my NAS, that is, as they used to appear in Thunderbird under local folders year-by-year. I also want to be able to archive more recent e-mails to the same location. That is, I want to re-establish the same archiving process I had previously, complete with access to the old archives. I've tried to set up the same file path to the NAS under Local Folders in Thunderbird (as far as I can remember - I might not have it correct) but the old archives don't appear. in an attempt to identify the correct file path on the NAS, I've tried to archive a recent message as a test so I can see where it is stored - in Thunderbird the year folder appears under the NAS location under local folders as expected and I can see the message in the message window so it seems to be working but I can't see any new folders or files on the NAS - nothing modified or created with today's date. I'd be grateful for any assistance. Thanks, Kevin

title: Cannot remove labels from messages
content:
I have 4 messages in my inbox (IMAP not Gmail). They are all labelled "Later" and one of them has a second tag "Important". These labels just appeared after I started using Thunderbird as from last month (2025-01-01). I found out how they should be removed: "More"-"Labels"-"0 - Remove all labels" or just click to toggle.

Expected behavour: Click to toggle off, stay off. Choose "0 - Remove all labels", stay removed

Actual behavour: With the pop up window open the label is gone, but when it's closed or another message selected, the label is back again.

Please help

Attached images: 1: Message is selected, go to "More"-"Labels"-"0 - Remove all labels" 2: Label is removed - for now 3: click on another message, the label is back

title: Auto-configuration works on Android but fails on desktop/Linux
content:
I have been providing auto-configuration information for my users. It used to work well but at some point it stopped working. When I try it on 128.7.1esr and create a new email account, the debug console shows me:

The config file XML does not contain an email account configuration. 2 AccountCreationUtils.sys.mjs:474:17 

   PriorityOrderAbortable resource:///modules/accountcreation/AccountCreationUtils.sys.mjs:474    _notifyFinished resource:///modules/accountcreation/AccountCreationUtils.sys.mjs:313    successCallback resource:///modules/accountcreation/AccountCreationUtils.sys.mjs:375    _response resource:///modules/accountcreation/FetchHTTP.sys.mjs:334    onload resource:///modules/accountcreation/FetchHTTP.sys.mjs:237    (Async: EventHandlerNonNull)    start resource:///modules/accountcreation/FetchHTTP.sys.mjs:236    _fetchConfigFromIsp resource:///modules/accountcreation/FetchConfig.sys.mjs:197    fetchConfigFromISP resource:///modules/accountcreation/FetchConfig.sys.mjs:107    findConfig chrome://messenger/content/accountcreation/accountSetup.js:727    onContinue chrome://messenger/content/accountcreation/accountSetup.js:618    onclick about:accountsetup:1

Thunderbird queries my web server using this URL: https://christoph-haas.de/.well-known/autoconfig/mail/config-v1.1.xml?emailaddress=footest123%40christoph-haas.de

My XML file:

<clientConfig version="1.1"> 

 <emailProvider id="christoph-haas.de">    <domain>christoph-haas.de</domain>    <displayName>Christoph's Mail Service</displayName>    <displayShortName>ISPmail</displayShortName>    <incomingServer type="imap">      <hostname>webmail.workaround.org</hostname>      <port>143</port>      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>      <username>%EMAILADDRESS%</username>    </incomingServer>    <outgoingServer type="smtp">      <hostname>webmail.workaround.org</hostname>      <port>587</port>      <socketType>STARTTLS</socketType>      <authentication>password-cleartext</authentication>      <username>%EMAILADDRESS%</username>    </outgoingServer>  </emailProvider>

</clientConfig>

I fail to see any errors in here.

I even tried with the reference configuration from https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Autoconfiguration:ConfigFileFormat but it failed as well. (I just found that the <serverURL> tag is not properly closed but that was easy to fix.)

Has anyone here seen that effect as well? Should I file a bug?

Thanks for your time! …Christoph
creator: email227
